 The center of the scale is at character position (center_x, center_y).

defs.name: BTermBuilder
defs.docs:
Provides a builder mechanism for initializing BTerm. You can chain builders together,
 and and with a call to `.build()`. This allows you to provide settings if you want to,
 or just use a simple initializer if you are in a hurry.

attributes.value: / Provides a builder mechanism for initializing BTerm. You can chain builders together,
/ and and with a call to `.build()`. This allows you to provide settings if you want to,
/ or just use a simple initializer if you are in a hurry.

defs.docs:
Provides a new, unconfigured, starting point for an BTerm session. You'll have to
 specify everything manually.

attributes.value: / Provides a new, unconfigured, starting point for an BTerm session. You'll have to
/ specify everything manually.

Character index
 This depends on the font but will usually be a code page 437 character

 `CP437_WINGDINGS.decode(...)` in the `codepage_437` crate!)

 that the new console not render background colors, so it can be layered on top of other consoles.

defs.name: render_xp_sprite
defs.value: pub fn render_xp_sprite(&mut Self, &super::rex::XpFile, i32, i32)
defs.docs:
Render a REX Paint (https://www.gridsagegames.com/rexpaint/) file as a sprite.
 The sprite will be offset by offset_x and offset_y.
 Transparent cells will not be rendered.

attributes.value: / Render a REX Paint (https://www.gridsagegames.com/rexpaint/) file as a sprite.
/ The sprite will be offset by offset_x and offset_y.
/ Transparent cells will not be rendered.

defs.name: to_xp_file
defs.value: pub fn to_xp_file(&Self, usize, usize) -> XpFile
defs.docs:
Saves the entire console stack to a REX Paint xp file. If your consoles are of
 varying sizes, the file format supports it - but REX doesn't. So you may want to
 avoid that. You can also get individual layers with to_xp_layer.

attributes.value: / Saves the entire console stack to a REX Paint xp file. If your consoles are of
/ varying sizes, the file format supports it - but REX doesn't. So you may want to
/ avoid that. You can also get individual layers with to_xp_layer.
